title: Kamala rakes in 3x more lakshmi than Trump but he milks mileage from free media coverage
content: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign secured $361 million in August, almost three times the amount raised by Donald Trump. Overall, her campaign has gathered $615 million, supported by both elite and grassroots donors. Both campaigns are concentrating their funds on key battleground states such as Pennsylvania and Georgia to sway voters.
summary: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign secured $361 million in August, almost three times the amount raised by Donald Trump. Overall, her campaign has gathered $615 million, supported by both elite and grassroots donors. Both campaigns are concentrating their funds on key battleground states such as Pennsylvania and Georgia to sway voters.

title: William and Kate have 'justifiable fear' about Harry, Meghan: 'Anything they say could...'
content: According to an insider, there will be no reunion until Harry and Meghan apologize to their Royal Highnesses for everything they have said and there's no indication that it is possible. "It's hard to see a reconciliation. How could there be when William and Catherine have the justifiable fear that anything they say could appear in a future book or be repeated in a TV programme," an insider said.
summary: According to an insider, there will be no reunion until Harry and Meghan apologize to their Royal Highnesses for everything they have said and there's no indication that it is possible. "It's hard to see a reconciliation. How could there be when William and Catherine have the justifiable fear that anything they say could appear in a future book or be repeated in a TV programme," an insider said.

title: 'Stupidest rich people clapping for Trump droning childcare is childcare'
content: During an event at the Economic Club of New York, Donald Trump was criticized for his unclear response to a question on childcare legislation. His answer, which included 'childcare is childcare,' left many puzzled. Commentators noted both Trump's lack of clarity and the audience's reaction to his remarks. Democrat analyst question what's the use of Donald Trump's so many interactions if he just says meaningless words.
summary: During an event at the Economic Club of New York, Donald Trump was criticized for his unclear response to a question on childcare legislation. His answer, which included 'childcare is childcare,' left many puzzled. Commentators noted both Trump's lack of clarity and the audience's reaction to his remarks. Democrat analyst question what's the use of Donald Trump's so many interactions if he just says meaningless words.

title: Georgia shooting suspect Colt Gray warned of life sentence if convicted
content: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect in a school shooting that killed two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School, appeared in court with his father Colin Gray. Colt is being tried as an adult. The weapon used was reportedly an AR-style rifle given by his father as a Christmas gift.
summary: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect in a school shooting that killed two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School, appeared in court with his father Colin Gray. Colt is being tried as an adult. The weapon used was reportedly an AR-style rifle given by his father as a Christmas gift.

title: American woman succumbs to gunshot wounds in West Bank
content: A 26-year-old American woman was fatally shot in the head while attending a pro-Palestinian demonstration against settlement expansion in Beita, West Bank. Witnesses and Palestinian media allege that Israeli troops fired the shot. The Israeli military has not yet commented on the incident, which follows another recent shooting of an American citizen at a similar protest.
summary: A 26-year-old American woman was fatally shot in the head while attending a pro-Palestinian demonstration against settlement expansion in Beita, West Bank. Witnesses and Palestinian media allege that Israeli troops fired the shot. The Israeli military has not yet commented on the incident, which follows another recent shooting of an American citizen at a similar protest.

title: Malaysia Airlines finds 'potential issue' on A350-900 engine
content: Malaysia Airlines discovered and addressed a potential engine problem in one of its Airbus A350-900 planes after the European Union Aviation Safety Agency issued an emergency directive for inspections on A350-1000s. This action followed an in-flight engine fire on a Cathay Pacific flight, leading to precautionary checks across similar aircraft models.
summary: Malaysia Airlines discovered and addressed a potential engine problem in one of its Airbus A350-900 planes after the European Union Aviation Safety Agency issued an emergency directive for inspections on A350-1000s. This action followed an in-flight engine fire on a Cathay Pacific flight, leading to precautionary checks across similar aircraft models.

title: Poland charges 3 Belarusians who forced diversion of plane to Minsk in 2021
content: Polish prosecutors have charged three Belarusian officials for diverting a Poland-registered plane in 2021, resulting in the arrest of dissident blogger Raman Pratasevich. Using a false bomb threat, they forced the plane traveling from Athens to Vilnius to land in Minsk. If convicted, they could face up to five years in prison.
summary: Polish prosecutors have charged three Belarusian officials for diverting a Poland-registered plane in 2021, resulting in the arrest of dissident blogger Raman Pratasevich. Using a false bomb threat, they forced the plane traveling from Athens to Vilnius to land in Minsk. If convicted, they could face up to five years in prison.

title: Does Andrew Tate dress like Kamala Harris? Expert's observation breaking internet
content: ​ Andrew Tate's rant against Kamala Harris went viral for a different reason after a menswear writer pointed out that Andrew Tate actually dresses like Kamala Harris -- similar shades, similar pantsuits. Tate's fans did not like the comparison though maximum reactions were of amusement as users found out that their dressing do actually match.
summary: ​ Andrew Tate's rant against Kamala Harris went viral for a different reason after a menswear writer pointed out that Andrew Tate actually dresses like Kamala Harris -- similar shades, similar pantsuits. Tate's fans did not like the comparison though maximum reactions were of amusement as users found out that their dressing do actually match.

title: Georgia School Shooting: JD Vance campaign slams AP for ‘brazenly lying’
content: "This is yet another case of the fake news media brazenly lying about a Republican politician. Senator Vance said exactly the opposite of what the Associated Press claimed. It should come as no surprise that the AP lost any and all credibility it had years ago, because they will lie about literally anything in order prop up the Democrats. Meanwhile, Kamala Harris has called for all police officers to be removed from schools, putting children all over America at risk. It's yet another example of how Kamala Harris's weak, failed, and dangerously liberal agenda makes her unfit for office.”
summary: "This is yet another case of the fake news media brazenly lying about a Republican politician. Senator Vance said exactly the opposite of what the Associated Press claimed. It should come as no surprise that the AP lost any and all credibility it had years ago, because they will lie about literally anything in order prop up the Democrats. Meanwhile, Kamala Harris has called for all police officers to be removed from schools, putting children all over America at risk. It's yet another example of how Kamala Harris's weak, failed, and dangerously liberal agenda makes her unfit for office.”

title: How Kate Middleton is preparing Prince George to become King
content: A key part of this preparation involves gradually exposing George to royal duties and events. "He is attending royal events such as Trooping the Colour, the Coronation, and big set events, and he is slowly being introduced to those," Dampier noted.
summary: A key part of this preparation involves gradually exposing George to royal duties and events. "He is attending royal events such as Trooping the Colour, the Coronation, and big set events, and he is slowly being introduced to those," Dampier noted.

title: French mass rape suspect among 'worst sexual criminals', says daughter
content: Dominique Pelicot, a 71-year-old retiree from France, faces trial for drugging his wife and arranging for strangers to rape her over nearly a decade. His daughter labeled him one of the worst sexual criminals in recent memory. The case has horrified France, with numerous suspects potentially facing up to 20 years in prison if found guilty.
summary: Dominique Pelicot, a 71-year-old retiree from France, faces trial for drugging his wife and arranging for strangers to rape her over nearly a decade. His daughter labeled him one of the worst sexual criminals in recent memory. The case has horrified France, with numerous suspects potentially facing up to 20 years in prison if found guilty.

title: Never-seen-before footage of JFK assassination shot by a Texas businessman emerges: What we know
content: Carpenter's grandson, James Gates, said the film was not much talked about in the family though everyone knew about it. Gates said he came into the possession of the film in 2009 or 2010 when his mother handed him a milk crate that had some 30 film reels including this one. When he first viewed the Kennedy footage, he was underwhelmed as it did not show Kennedy but he was struck by Hill's bravery.
summary: Carpenter's grandson, James Gates, said the film was not much talked about in the family though everyone knew about it. Gates said he came into the possession of the film in 2009 or 2010 when his mother handed him a milk crate that had some 30 film reels including this one. When he first viewed the Kennedy footage, he was underwhelmed as it did not show Kennedy but he was struck by Hill's bravery.

title: Pope Francis arrives in Papua New Guinea, country two of 12-day trip
content: Pope Francis arrived in Papua New Guinea from Indonesia on Friday evening, continuing his extensive 12-day tour across Southeast Asia and Oceania. Greeted by Deputy Prime Minister John Rosso, he will address political leaders and visit Vanimo before traveling to East Timor and Singapore. The pope's visit emphasizes environmental issues, including climate change.
summary: Pope Francis arrived in Papua New Guinea from Indonesia on Friday evening, continuing his extensive 12-day tour across Southeast Asia and Oceania. Greeted by Deputy Prime Minister John Rosso, he will address political leaders and visit Vanimo before traveling to East Timor and Singapore. The pope's visit emphasizes environmental issues, including climate change.

title: Paetongtarn Shinawatra sworn in as new Thai PM
content: Thailand swore Paetongtarn Shinawatra in as prime minister on Friday, capping a month of political tumult that saw her predecessor thrown out of office and the main opposition party dissolved. Paetongtarn took the oath in a closed-15 pm (1115 GMT), officially becoming Thailand's youngest-ever prime minister. bur-srg/ssy
summary: Thailand swore Paetongtarn Shinawatra in as prime minister on Friday, capping a month of political tumult that saw her predecessor thrown out of office and the main opposition party dissolved. Paetongtarn took the oath in a closed-15 pm (1115 GMT), officially becoming Thailand's youngest-ever prime minister. bur-srg/ssy

title: UK court jails people trafficker for 10 years
content: A British court has sentenced Anas al-Mustafa to 10 years in prison for smuggling seven migrants in a hidden van compartment. The migrants, discovered on a ship from France to England, were found in dire conditions, suffering from dehydration and other severe health issues. This case underscores the perils faced by individuals attempting illegal entry into the UK.
summary: A British court has sentenced Anas al-Mustafa to 10 years in prison for smuggling seven migrants in a hidden van compartment. The migrants, discovered on a ship from France to England, were found in dire conditions, suffering from dehydration and other severe health issues. This case underscores the perils faced by individuals attempting illegal entry into the UK.

title: Sweden joins countries seeking to end screen time for children under 2
content: Sweden's public health agency recommends that children under 2 should avoid digital screens entirely, with limited screen time for older age groups. Similar guidelines are seen in other countries including the US, Ireland, Canada, Australia, and France. Concerns focus on negative impacts on sleep, mental health, and physical activity. Policymakers call for tech companies to adjust algorithms to protect children.
summary: Sweden's public health agency recommends that children under 2 should avoid digital screens entirely, with limited screen time for older age groups. Similar guidelines are seen in other countries including the US, Ireland, Canada, Australia, and France. Concerns focus on negative impacts on sleep, mental health, and physical activity. Policymakers call for tech companies to adjust algorithms to protect children.

title: Man jailed for 9 years for setting fire to asylum seekers' hotel in UK anti-Muslim riots
content: Thomas Birley, aged 27, received a nine-year prison sentence for arson at a hotel housing asylum seekers amid anti-Muslim riots. He admitted to starting the fire with intent to endanger life. The unrest was sparked by misinformation after the killings of three girls in Southport, leading to widespread violence and arrests.
summary: Thomas Birley, aged 27, received a nine-year prison sentence for arson at a hotel housing asylum seekers amid anti-Muslim riots. He admitted to starting the fire with intent to endanger life. The unrest was sparked by misinformation after the killings of three girls in Southport, leading to widespread violence and arrests.

title: UK appoints former PM Blair's top aide to lead talks on control of Chagos Islands
content: Britain has named Jonathan Powell, ex-chief of staff to Tony Blair, as its special envoy for negotiations with Mauritius regarding the Chagos Islands' sovereignty. Detached from Mauritius in 1965, these islands host a crucial US military base on Diego Garcia. The British government seeks to maintain this base's long-term operations while addressing Mauritius' claims.
summary: Britain has named Jonathan Powell, ex-chief of staff to Tony Blair, as its special envoy for negotiations with Mauritius regarding the Chagos Islands' sovereignty. Detached from Mauritius in 1965, these islands host a crucial US military base on Diego Garcia. The British government seeks to maintain this base's long-term operations while addressing Mauritius' claims.

title: One dead, dozens injured in Russian strikes on Ukraine's Pavlograd
content: Russian missile strikes on Pavlograd in central Ukraine killed one person and injured more than 50 others, including three children. Five Iskander ballistic missiles were fired, causing several fires in the city. This attack is part of increased Russian aerial assaults following Ukraine's cross-border offensive into Russia's Kursk region last month.
summary: Russian missile strikes on Pavlograd in central Ukraine killed one person and injured more than 50 others, including three children. Five Iskander ballistic missiles were fired, causing several fires in the city. This attack is part of increased Russian aerial assaults following Ukraine's cross-border offensive into Russia's Kursk region last month.

title: 'Terror threat': Indonesia arrests seven over failed plot to attack Pope Francis
content: Indonesian authorities have arrested seven individuals for issuing online terror threats against Pope Francis during his visit aimed at promoting religious unity. Heightened security measures include around 4,000 personnel to ensure the pope's safety. The suspects are accused of posting bomb threats on social media concerning the pope's public meetings in Jakarta.
summary: Indonesian authorities have arrested seven individuals for issuing online terror threats against Pope Francis during his visit aimed at promoting religious unity. Heightened security measures include around 4,000 personnel to ensure the pope's safety. The suspects are accused of posting bomb threats on social media concerning the pope's public meetings in Jakarta.
